Description: Name of the country
Date of the record in YYYYMMDD.
Record closings of schools and universities
Coding (if given):
0 - no measures
1 - recommend closing or all schools open with alterations resulting in significant differences compared to non-Covid-19 operations
2 - require closing (only some levels or categories, eg just high school, or just public schools)
3 - require closing all levels
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Record closings of workplaces
Coding (if given):
0 - no measures
1 - recommend closing (or recommend work from home) or all businesses open with alterations resulting in significant differences compared to non-Covid-19 operation
2 - require closing (or work from home) for some sectors or categories of workers
3 - require closing (or work from home) for all-but-essential workplaces (eg grocery stores, doctors)
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Record cancelling public events
Coding (if given):
0 - no measures
1 - recommend cancelling
2 - require cancelling
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Record the cut-off size for limits on gatherings
Coding (if given):
0 - no restrictions
1 - restrictions on very large gatherings (the limit is above 1000 people)
2 - restrictions on gatherings between 101-1000 people
3 - restrictions on gatherings between 11-100 people
4 - restrictions on gatherings of 10 people or less
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Record closing of public transport
Coding (if given):
0 - no measures
1 - recommend closing (or significantly reduce volume/route/means of transport available)
2 - require closing (or prohibit most citizens from using it)
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Record orders to "shelter-in-place" and otherwise confine to the home
Coding (if given):
0 - no measures
1 - recommend not leaving house
2 - require not leaving house with exceptions for daily exercise, grocery shopping, and 'essential' trips
3 - require not leaving house with minimal exceptions (eg allowed to leave once a week, or only one person can leave at a time, etc)
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Record restrictions on internal movement between cities/regions
Coding (if given):
0 - no measures
1 - recommend not to travel between regions/cities
2 - internal movement restrictions in place
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description:
Record restrictions on international travel

Note: this records policy for foreign travellers, not citizens
Coding (if given):
0 - no restrictions
1 - screening arrivals
2 - quarantine arrivals from some or all regions
3 - ban arrivals from some regions
4 - ban on all regions or total border closure
Blank - no data

Description:
Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work.

Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries
Coding (if given):
0 - no income support
1 - government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is less than 50% median salary)
2 - government is replacing 50% or more of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is greater than 50% median salary)
Blank - no data

0 - formal sector workers only or informal sector workers only
1 - all workers

Description: Record if the government is freezing financial obligations for households (eg stopping loan repayments, preventing services like water from stopping, or banning evictions)
Coding (if given):
0 - no debt/contract relief
1 - narrow relief, specific to one kind of contract
2 - broad debt/contract relief

Description: Announced economic stimulus spending
Coding (if given):
Record monetary value in USD of fiscal stimuli, includes any spending or tax cuts NOT included in E4, H4 or H5
0 - no new spending that day
Blank - no data

Description: Announced offers of Covid-19 related aid spending to other countries
Coding (if given):
Record monetary value in USD
0 - no new spending that day
Blank - no data

Description: Record presence of public info campaigns
Coding (if given):
0 - no Covid-19 public information campaign
1 - public officials urging caution about Covid-19
2- coordinated public information campaign (eg across traditional and social media)
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Record government policy on who has access to testing
Coding (if given):
0 - no testing policy
1 - only those who both (a) have symptoms AND (b) meet specific criteria (eg key workers, admitted to hospital, came into contact with a known case, returned from overseas)
2 - testing of anyone showing Covid-19 symptoms
3 - open public testing (eg "drive through" testing available to asymptomatic people)
Blank - no data

Description: Record government policy on contact tracing after a positive diagnosis
Coding (if given):
0 - no contact tracing
1 - limited contact tracing; not done for all cases
2 - comprehensive contact tracing; done for all identified cases

Description:
Announced short term spending on healthcare system, eg hospitals, masks, etc

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
Coding (if given):
Record monetary value in USD
0 - no new spending that day
Blank - no data

Description:
Announced public spending on Covid-19 vaccine development

Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
Coding (if given):
Record monetary value in USD
0 - no new spending that day
Blank - no data

Description: Record policies on the use of facial coverings outside the home
Coding (if given):
0 - No policy
1 - Recommended
2 - Required in some specified shared/public spaces outside the home with other people present, or some situations when social distancing not possible
3 - Required in all shared/public spaces outside the home with other people present or all situations when social distancing not possible
4 - Required outside the home at all times regardless of location or presence of other people

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Record policies for vaccine delivery for different groups
Coding (if given):
0 - No availability
1 - Availability for ONE of following: key workers/ clinically vulnerable groups (non elderly) / elderly groups
2 - Availability for TWO of following: key workers/ clinically vulnerable groups (non elderly) / elderly groups
3 - Availability for ALL of following: key workers/ clinically vulnerable groups (non elderly) / elderly groups
4 - Availability for all three plus partial additional availability (select broad groups/ages)
5 - Universal availability

0 - At cost to individual (or funded by NGO, insurance, or partially government funded)
1- No or minimal cost to individual (government funded or subsidised)
Blank - no data

Description: Record policies for protecting elderly people (as defined locally) in Long Term Care Facilities and/or the community and home setting
Coding (if given):
0 - no measures
1 - Recommended isolation, hygiene, and visitor restriction measures in LTCFs and/or elderly people to stay at home
2 - Narrow restrictions for isolation, hygiene in LTCFs, some limitations on external visitors and/or restrictions protecting elderly people at home
3 - Extensive restrictions for isolation and hygiene in LTCFs, all non-essential external visitors prohibited, and/or all elderly people required to stay at home and not leave the home with minimal exceptions, and receive no external visitors
Blank - no data

0 - targeted
1- general
Blank - no data

Description: Reports the existence of a prioritised plan for vaccine rollout
Coding (if given):
Blank – no data
0 - no plan
1 – a prioritised plan is in place
2 – universal/general eligibility; no prioritisation between groups

Description: Reports whether any categories of people are receiving vaccines
Coding (if given):
Blank – no data
0 – no categories are receiving vaccines
1 – vaccines are available to some categories
2 – vaccines are available to anyone over the age of 16 yrs
3 – vaccines are available to anyone over the age of 16 yrs PLUS one or both of 5-15 yrs and 0-4 yrs

Column_Name: V2B_Vaccine age eligibility/availability age floor (general population summary)
Description: Reports lowest age range of general population being vaccinated
Coding (if given):
Blank – no data

0 – no categories are receiving vaccines

numerical range – Lowest age range for ‘General’ category

Column_Name: V2C_Vaccine age eligibility/availability age floor (at risk summary)
Description: Reports lowest age range of at risk population being vaccinated
Coding (if given):
Blank – no data

0 – no categories are receiving vaccines

numerical range – Lowest age range from either ‘General’ or ‘At-risk’ categories

Description:
Reports the number of categories selected from thematic group:
V2_At risk age ranges below 60 (one or more selected counts as 1 x category)
V2_Clinically vulnerable/chronic illness/significant underlying health condition (excluding elderly and disabled)
V2_Disabled people
V2_Pregnant people
V2_People living with a vulnerable/shielding person or other priority group
Coding (if given):
Blank – no data
0 – no categories are receiving vaccines
1 – 1 or 2 categories in group selected
2 – 3 or more categories selected or all from V2_General 16-19 years up to V2_General 80+ yearspresen

Description:
Reports the number of categories selected from thematic group:
V2_Educators
V2_Primary and secondary school students
V2_Tertiary education students
Coding (if given):
Blank – no data
0 – no categories are receiving vaccines
1 – 1 category in group selected
2 - 2 or more categories selected or all from V2_General 16-19 years up to V2_General 80+ years present

Description:
Reports the number of categories selected from thematic group: V2_Police/first responders
V2_Airport/Border/Airline staff
V2_Factory workers
V2_Frontline retail workers
V2_Military
V2_Other high contact professions/groups (taxi drivers, security guards)
V2_Frontline/essential workers (when subcategories not specified) (triggers an automatic 2)
Coding (if given):
Blank – no data
0 – no categories are receiving vaccines
1 – 1 or 2 categories in group selected
2 - 3 or more categories selected or all from V2_General 16-19 years up to V2_General 80+ years present

Description:
Reports the number of categories selected from thematic group:
V2_Staff working in an elderly care home
V2_Healthcare workers/carers (excluding care home staff)
Coding (if given):
Blank – no data
0 – no categories are receiving vaccines
1 – 1 category in group selected
2 - 2 categories selected or all from V2_General 16-19 years up to V2_General 80+ years present

Description: Reports the overall approach taken to vaccine funding – whether paid by the individual or the government
Coding (if given):
Blank - no data
0 – no availability
1 – full cost to the individual for all categories identified in V2
2 – full cost to the individual for some categories identified in V2, some subsidy for other categories
3- partial funding by the government for all of the categories identified in V2
4 – partial funding by the government for some categories identified in V2, full funding for other categories
5 – all categories fully funded by the government

Description: Reports the existence of a requirement to be vaccinated
Coding (if given):
Blank - no data
0 – no requirement to be vaccinated
1 – requirement to be vaccinated is in place for one or more groups

Description: The cumulative number of reported covid-19 cases since the beginning of the pandemic
Coding (if given): Number of covid-19 cases

Description: The cumulative number of deaths attributed to covid-19 since the beginning of the pandemic
Record a binary indicator of majority (non-)vaccinated.
Coding (if given):
NV - the majority of the population is unvaccinated (used in jurisdictions where we do not have regular vaccination rate data)
V - the majority of the population is vaccinated (used in jurisdictions where we do not have regular vaccination rate data)
Blank - no data

Description: The percentage of fully vaccinated population in the jurisdiction, or, depending on data availability, a binary indicator of whether the majority of people are unvaccinated or vaccinated.
Coding (if given):
Number - the proportion of the population that is reported as vaccinated by that jurisdiction
Under 50%* - the majority of the population is unvaccinated (used in jurisdictions where we do not have regular vaccination rate data)
Over 50%* - the majority of the population is vaccinated (used in jurisdictions where we do not have regular vaccination rate data)
Blank - no data

Description: Weighted Average of C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, C7, C8 and H1
Weighted Average of C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, C7, C8, E1, E2, H1, H2, H3, H6, H7, H8
Weighted Average of C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, C7, C8, H1, H2, H3, H6, H7, H8
Weighted Average of E1 and E2
